data.name: Cash Investment Account
data.description: The Westpac Cash Investment Account has been designed with Westpac share investors in mind by offering access to low brokerage, competitive interest rates, convenient features and seamless trade settlements.

features.additionalInfo: Low brokerage: Enjoy our lowest brokerage rate starting from $19.95 when you settle your trades through a Westpac Cash Investment Account.
Competitive interest: Receive a competitive at-call interest rate with interest calculated daily and paid monthly.
Earn bonus interest (currently 0.30% p.a.) when you settle three or more trades in a calendar month
No minimum account balance is required to earn standard and bonus interest.
24/7 access to your account via Online Banking and Mobile Banking.
View your available funds when placing a trade.
Enjoy the benefit of having one account to manage your investment cash flows.
Option to participate in our Dividend Direction Service. Save time and enjoy the convenience of your Westpac Cash Investment Account being automatically nominated to receive your dividends.

Our Dividend Direction Service offers you the convenience of having your Westpac Cash Investment Account automatically nominated to receive the dividends from all your current CHESS sponsored holdings.
The account can be opened online only.
Funds at call facility is available for this product .
You will get quarterly regular statements.
Interest is paid on monthly basis.
Bills can be paid using BPAY.
Direct debits can be set up.
Must be linked to a Westpac Share Trading account.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Individuals should be over 18 years of age.
Eligible for Businesses and Trusts that have a Westpac Share Trading account.

fees.additionalInfo: Automated telephone banking

fees.additionalInfo: Staff assisted telephone banking

fees.name: Online Banking
fees.additionalInfo: Westpac Online Banking

fees.additionalInfo: Direct Debits ? Westpac Share Trading.

fees.additionalInfo: Direct Debits ? Other

fees.name: Branch assisted deposit
fees.additionalInfo: Branch staff-assisted deposit.

fees.name: Branch assisted withdrawal
fees.additionalInfo: Branch staff-assisted withdrawals.

fees.name: Self served deposits
fees.additionalInfo: Self service (electronic) deposits.

fees.name: Self served withdrawals
fees.additionalInfo: Self service (electronic) withdrawals.

fees.name: Money Transfer
fees.additionalInfo: Pay anyone free of cost .

fees.name: Overdrawn
fees.additionalInfo:
This fee is applicable for each transaction that: 1.Overdraws your account or further overdraws the account;2.Is a withdrawal against uncleared funds; or
3.Exceeds the available funds in the account at the time of the transaction.(Other Bank Charges)

fees.name: Issue of a Bank cheque
fees.additionalInfo: Staff assisted issue of bank cheque

fees.name: Issue of a Bank cheque
fees.additionalInfo: Online (for Bank customers only and includes a customised remittance plus postage and handling).

fees.name: Cheques Processing
fees.additionalInfo: Cheques processed through the clearing system, and phone or mail answer is obtained.

fees.name: Cheques Processing
fees.additionalInfo: ?On-the-spot? answer at the branch on which the cheque is drawn.

fees.name: Item Delivery fee
fees.additionalInfo: Items delivered to another branch or bank (where available).

fees.name: Special statement fee
fees.additionalInfo: if you require a statement of transactions on your account to be sent to you earlier than your next statement is due.

fees.name: Additional copies of  statement
fees.additionalInfo:
if you receive paper statements and want extra copies of your original statement mailed to you or to a nominated person, we can do this but you will need to let us know prior
to your original statement being issued.

fees.name: Duplicate statement
fees.additionalInfo: if you require an extra copy and your original statement has already been issued, we can order a duplicate statement for you. Note, duplicate statements are not issued within 5 working days of the original statement date.

fees.name: Online Banking statement
fees.additionalInfo: A list of transactions which you can see and print out from westpac.com.au, Provides details of your last 100 transactions plus up to the last 7 years statements.

fees.name: Telephone Banking statement
fees.additionalInfo: A  list of transactions available for mail delivery through self-service Telephone Banking. In addition you can listen to a list of recent transactions via self-service for free or via staff-assistance (subject to the free account enquiry limit).This will give All transactions since your last statement.

fees.name: ATM Mini statement
fees.additionalInfo:
A list of transactions available through Westpac ATMs on accounts linked to your card. Provides details of up to the last 10 transactions since your last statement,
together with your current balance.

fees.name: Voucher retrieval
fees.additionalInfo: if you want us to physically locate a paper copy of a withdrawal slip, cheque or deposit slip that you have previously given us, we can do this. This service is available by calling Telephone Banking or at any branch.

fees.name: Optional deposit services fee
fees.additionalInfo: If a deposit slip is included in the envelope with the deposit.

fees.name: Optional deposit services fee
fees.additionalInfo: If a deposit slip is not included in the envelope with the deposit

fees.name: Westpac Online Banking fee
fees.additionalInfo: By ?Pay Anyone? function on Westpac Online Banking.

fees.name: Outward dishonour
fees.additionalInfo: Each transaction that is dishonoured due to insufficient available funds in the account.

depositRates.additionalInfo: Interest is calculated daily using a tiered interest rate, meaning the particular interest rate that applies to you will depend on the daily closing balance of your Cash Investment Account.
